ans.f1: HTML describes the structure of a webpage
ans.f2: HTML is the standard markup language mainly used to create web pages
ans.f3: HTML consists of a set of elements that helps the browser how to view the

exp: Explanation: HTML is the standard markup language mainly used to create web pages. HTML describes the structure and layout of a webpage. HTML consists of a series of elements that helps the browser how to display content easily.
Explanation: HTML stands for “HyperText Markup Language”. HTML is the standard markup language mainly used to design and create web pages and web applications.

q: What is the correct syntax of doctype in HTML5?
exp: Explanation: The correct syntax of HTML5 doctype is <!doctype html>, doctype is the very first thing to write in HTML5. <!doctype html> or <!DOCTYPE HTML> both are same because doctype keyword is not case sensitive.

q: Which of the following is used to read an HTML page and render it?
exp: Explanation: A web browser (commonly referred to as a browser) is a software application for retrieving, presenting and traversing information resources on the World Wide Web. A web server process, store and display output to the client as per their request. Web matrix is a discontinued cloud-connected website builder and HTML editor for Windows.

q: Which of the following is not a difference between HTML and XHTML?

ans.f1: Tags and attributes are case-insensitive in HTML but not in XHTML
ans.f2: Special characters must be escaped using character entities in XHTML unlike HTML
ans.f3: Charset in html is “text/html” where as in xhtml it is “application/xml+xhtml”
ans.t: Charset in both html and xhtml is “text/html”

exp: Explanation: HTML is case insensitive while XHTML is case sensitive. In XHTML, special characters can be escaped using character entites but not in HTML. Charset in HTML is “text/html” where as it is “application/xml+xhtml” for XHTML.

q: Which of the following tag is used for inserting the largest heading in HTML?
exp: Explanation: Headings in HTML starts from <h1> to <h6> in which <h1> heading is the largest one and <h6> is smallest one among those. The heading tags are <h1> <h2> <h3> <h4> <h5> and <h6> that are used for the creations of headings.

ans.t: Convention for representing and interacting with objects in html documents

exp: Explanation: The Document Object Model is a cross-platform and language-independent application programming interface that treats an HTML, XHTML, or XML document as a tree structure. A document can be viewed as a logical tree with help of DOM Model.
